articles.title: About this site
articles.contents:
This is a website (and github repository) of data and code for our work about impact of COVID on TB notifications in Blantyre Malawi.
We are the Malawi Liverpool Wellcome Population Health group; a group of reseachers affiliated with Malawi-Liverpool-Wellcome, Liverpool School of Tropical Medicine, London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine, College of Medicine at University of Malawi and University of Sheffield.
The TB electronic reporting system is a partnership between our group and Malawi National TB programme and Blantyre District Health Office.
Some more information about our research group is available at Dr Peter MacPherson’s group manual here https://petermacp.github.io/mlw.public.health.group/ .
More data about TB epidemiology in Blantyre is here https://github.com/petermacp/BlantyreTBEpi (a companion package to the paper ‘MacPherson, P. et al. Disparities in access to diagnosis and care in Blantyre, Malawi, identified through enhanced tuberculosis surveillance and spatial analysis. BMC Medicine 17, 21 (2019). https://doi.org/10.1186/s12916-019-1260-6’ )
If you have any questions, we’d be happy to discuss. A good first port of call is probably peter.macpherson [at] lstmed [dot] ac [dot] uk or rachaelburke [at] lshtm [dot] ac [dot] uk.

articles.title: Code
articles.description: Code for our Interrupted Time Series Analysis

articles.title: TB COVID Blantyre
articles.description: A website for our code and data about impact of COVID on TB notifications in Blantyre
articles.contents:
This is a website and github repository for our project about impact of COVID-19 on TB notifications in Blantyre, Malawi.
The github repo is at https://github.com/rachaelmburke/tbcovidblantyre
Here you will find
R markdown file with analyses
Knitted R markdown file (same as the one on this webpage)
.csv file of monthly total TB case notifications from June 2016 until December 2020
.rdata file of modelled quarterly Blantyre population by age and sex (based on Govt of Malawi censuses in 2008 and 2018, with thanks to Chu Chang Ku)
